title: E-government impact on developing smart cities initiative in Saudi Arabia: Opportunities & challenges
technology_discussed: Internet of Things; Cloud computing; Big data
research_description: The article explores the impact of e-government on the development of smart cities in Saudi Arabia. It discusses opportunities and challenges in implementing e-government and smart city initiatives, focusing on technological innovations like IoT, big data, and cloud computing. The study evaluates the maturity models of e-government and their role in the transition to smart cities, using Saudi Arabia as a case study.
research_results: The findings indicate that the adoption of e-government in Saudi Arabia plays a crucial role in the development of smart cities. However, challenges such as infrastructure limitations, cybersecurity concerns, and public trust need to be addressed. The integration of e-government with smart city projects enhances governance, transparency, and public service delivery.
future_research: Future research could explore the scalability of these findings to other countries in the region and examine the long-term effects of e-government initiatives on smart city sustainability.
